description: The Analyzed Chlorophyll products are generated by combining OCM-3 derived chlorophyll observations with coupled physical-biogeochemical model simulation of chlorophyll using particle filter based assimilation technique. The model utilized is MOM5, coupled with biogeochemical model TOPAZ.

name: 3RIMG_L1B_STD
description: Level1 data for Imager 6 channels at half hour interval

name: 3RIMG_L1C_ASIA_MER
description: IMAGER- 6 channel Level1 data in Mercator projection for Asian Sector

name: 3RIMG_L1C_SGP
description: Level1 IMAGER 6 channel  data of TIR1, TIR2, WV, VIS, SWIR, MIR Bands in Mercator projection

name: 3RIMG_L2B_CMK
description: INSAT-3DR VHRR measures radiances in one visible and one SWIR band at 1 km spatial resolution, one MIR and two TIR bands at 4 km resolution, and one WV band at 8 km resolution. Radiances from 3 IR spectral bands TIR ?1 , TIR ?2 and MIR which are of same resolution of 4km are used in the INSAT cloud mask algorithm to estimate whether a given view of the earth surface is unobstructed by clouds

name: 3RIMG_L2B_CTP
description: Cloud top properties derived using INSAT3R IMAGER

name: 3RIMG_L2B_HEM
description: This product is derived on the basis of Hydro-Estimator method. It measures precipitation over Indian Region encompassing area between longitudes 30°E -to130°E and latitudes 50°N- 50°S.

name: 3RIMG_L2B_IMC
description: INSAT multispectral Rainfall Algorithm Technique (IMSRA) is one of the main operational rainfall retrieval algorithms for INSAT-3DR. This algorithm estimates precipitation based on non-linear power law relationship established between infrared (IR) brightness temperatures (Tbs, 10.7 µm observations) and TRMM-PR surface rain rate.  Based on a number of case studies and research works carried out, a further refinement of the algorithm was made.

name: 3RIMG_L2B_LST
description: Land surface temperature (LST) is a key parameter in the land surface processes. LST is very useful input to various models related to agrometeorology, ecology, hydrology and climate.

name: 3RIMG_L2B_OLR
description: Total outgoing longwave radiation (OLR) flux, thermally emitted from earth atmosphere system, is estimated by applying regression equation relating OLR flux with INSAT-3DR Imager observed WV (6.7μm) and thermal infrared (TIR-1 10.5 μm and TIR-2 11.5 μm) radiances. The coefficients of the regression equations are determined from results of the Radiative Transfer Model simulation with various atmospheric conditions

name: 3RIMG_L2B_SST
description: Sea surface temperature is derived from split thermal window channels (TIR1, TIR2) during daytime and using additional mid IR window channel (MIR) during night time over cloud free oceanic regions. The most important part of the SST retrieval from IR observations is the atmospheric correction, especially over tropics. This correction is determined through a suitable characterization of tropical atmospheres in radiative transfer model to simulate the brightness temperatures of INSAT-3DR channels a

name: 3RIMG_L2B_UTH
description: Upper Tropospheric Humidity from IMAGER

name: 3RIMG_L2C_CMP
description: Day-time cloud microphysical parameters from visible and SWIR channels of INSAT-3DR imager

name: 3RIMG_L2C_FOG
description: Night time FOG is derived from TIR-1 and MIR channel brightness temperature over Indian region. However, for day time visible channel reflectance and TIR-1 channel brightness temperature has been used. The algorithm involves detection of different thresholds following an image based approach to detect FOG

name: 3RIMG_L2C_INS
description: INSAT-3DR derived INSOLATION

name: 3RIMG_L2C_SNW
description: Snow cover derived from IMAGER

name: 3RIMG_L2G_AOD
description: The AOD product provides the aerosol optical thickness, at 650 nm and 4 Km spatial resolution over both land and ocean surfaces with root mean square (RMS) error of ±0.1.

name: 3RIMG_L2G_GPI
description: Rainfall from INSAT-3DR Imager channels is derived based on two methodologies: (i) Rainfall Estimation by GOES Precipitation Index (GPI) (ii) INSAT Multispectral Rainfall Algorithm .

name: 3RIMG_L2G_IMR
description: Indian Multi Spectral rainfall from IMAGER

name: 3RIMG_L2G_WDP
description: Wind Derived Product, Upper level divergence, lower level convergence, wind shear, mid-level wind shear, 24 hour wind shear tendency, vorticity(200,500,700,850mb) using INSAT-3DR AMVs.

name: 3RIMG_L2P_FIR
description: This is an Active FIRE product which shows that the pixel is warm enough to be qualified as fire. This is derived using MIR (T3) and TIR1 (T5) channel BT from INSAT-3DR imager.

name: 3RIMG_L2P_IRW
description: INSAT-3DR Infrared channel derived Wind

name: 3RIMG_L2P_IRW_MERGED
description: this porduct is a merged wind product using the algorithm for retrieving Atmospheric Motion Vectors (AMVs) from INSAT-3D and INSAT-3DR in staggering mode

name: 3RIMG_L2P_MRW
description: Winds derived using MIR band data of IMAGER

name: 3RIMG_L2P_SMK
description: This is an Active Smoke product which shows that the pixel is to be qualified as smoke.Inputs to the algorithm will include geo-referenced, corrected  Albedo, Digital counts for Visible channel and geo-referenced Brightness temperature for MIR,TIR1, TIR2.

name: 3RIMG_L2P_VSW
description: Winds derived using Visible band data of IMAGER

name: 3RIMG_L2P_WVW
description: Water vapour derived wind vectors

name: 3RIMG_L2P_WV_MERGED
description: This product is amerged wind product using the algorithm for retrieving Atmospheric Motion Vectors (AMVs) from INSAT-3D and INSAT-3DR in staggering mode

name: 3RIMG_L3C_PET_DLY
description: Evapotranspiration (ET) is one of the important processes in the terrestrial water cycle. About 65% of rainwater is lost to the atmosphere due to the combined processes of evaporation and transpiration. In a given climate, reference evapotranspiration (ET0) is defined as the maximum evaporative demand of the atmosphere from a well-watered surface independent of crop type, crop development, and management practice.

name: 3DIMG_L2G_SST
description: Sea surface temperature is derived from split thermal window channels (TIR1, TIR2) during daytime and using additional mid IR window channel (MIR) during night time over cloud free oceanic regions. The most important part of the SST retrieval from IR observations is the atmospheric correction, especially over tropics. This correction is determined through a suitable characterization of tropical atmospheres in radiative transfer model to simulate the brightness temperatures of INSAT-3D channels and then generating the regression coefficients for SST retrieval.

name: 3DIMG_L2P_SMK

name: 3DIMG_L3C_PET_DLY
description: Evapotranspiration (ET) is one of the important processes in the terrestrial water cycle. About 65% of rainwater is lost to the atmosphere due to the combined processes of evaporation and transpiration. In a given climate, reference evapotranspiration (ET0) is defined as the maximum evaporative demand of the atmosphere from a well-watered surface independent of crop type, crop development, and management practice.

name: 3DSND_L2B_PFL
description: INSAT-3D carries an 18-channel infrared Sounder (plus a visible channel). The algorithm is designed for retrieving vertical profiles of atmospheric temperature and moisture along with total column ozone content in the atmosphere from clear sky infrared radiances in different absorption bands observed through INSAT-3D. Sounder derived profiles include temperature at 40 vertical pressure levels from surface to about 70 km and water vapor in 21 levels from surface to around 15 km.

name: MT1MADSGPL2A
description: Surface wind speed (m/s), total precipitable water (g/cm sq.) and cloud liquid water (mg/cm sq.) content over oceans are derived using 18.7, 23.8 and 36.5 GHz channels.Rain flags are generated using 89 GHz.

description: Radiance Values for infrared, solar, synthetic_LW, total and Visible channels

description: Radiance Values for infrared, solar, synthetic_LW, total and Visible channels

name: atm_prf_igr_1d
description: ROSA Level-1 igr  products which are  processed with a latency of 2 days and it provide the profiles of (i) the behaviour of the excess phase with respect to time of an occulting event; (ii) the behaviour of the bending angle with respect to impact parameter of all occulting events;  (iii) the behaviour of the refractivity with respect to the height

name: atm_prf_igr_l2
description: This igr file is in NetCDF format and contains neutral atmospheric profiles of geo physical parameters such as Refractivity, Dry temperature, Temperature, Pressure and Water vapour pressure as well as latitude and longitude profiles at observed geometric heights of ray perigee point.It is processed with a latency of 2-3 days.

name: atm_prf_igs_1d
description: ROSA Level-1 igs products which provide the profiles of (i) the behaviour of the excess phase with respect to time of an occulting event; (ii) the behaviour of the bending angle with respect to impact parameter of all occulting events;  (iii) the behaviour of the refractivity with respect to the height

name: atm_prf_igs_l2
description: This igu file is in NetCDF format and contains neutral atmospheric profiles of geo physical parameters such as Refractivity, Dry temperature, Temperature, Pressure and Water vapour pressure as well as latitude and longitude profiles at observed geometric heights of ray perigee point.It is processed with a latency of around 2 weeks.

name: atm_prf_igu_1d
description: ROSA Level-1 igu products which are processed in real time and it provide the profiles of (i) the behaviour of the excess phase with respect to time of an occulting event; (ii) the behaviour of the bending angle with respect to impact parameter of all occulting events;  (iii) the behaviour of the refractivity with respect to the height

name: atm_prf_igu_l2
description: This igu file is in NetCDF format and contains neutral atmospheric profiles of geo physical parameters such as Refractivity, Dry temperature, Temperature, Pressure and Water vapour pressure as well as latitude and longitude profiles at observed geometric heights of ray perigee point.It is processed in real time.

name: O2-SCT-HWV
description: This product is generated making use of Backscatter data at composite slice level as available in L2A product of OSCAT and L2B wind vector product from OSCAT presently at 50km wind vector cells. Wind directions at composite slice location are interpolated utilizing neighbouring cells while wind speed is recalculated using backscattering coefficient and the OSCAT specific GMF. The quality flag of L2B product is reproduced.
